title: Local athletes cop medals at Special Olympics
text:
Contributed Medal winners 
Mercer County athletes brought home medals recently from the state Sectional Special Olympic Games Competition. Competitors from left are: front — Pauline Franklin and Mary Nigro; back — Paul Paquet and Kenneth Beasom. Contributed Locals do well 
Mercer County athletes brought home medals recently from the state Sectional Special Olympic Games Competition. Competitors from left are: Garin Hernandez, Aaron Plummer, Joseph Mezaros and Evan Ohlinger. Posted: Monday, October 5, 2015 7:19 am Local athletes cop medals at Special Olympics Herald Sports Staff The Herald 
Eight athletes from Mercer County competed in the Pennsylvania State Special Olympics Sectional Games held recently at Slippery Rock University, bringing home 9 gold medals and 1 bronze. These athletes competed in bocce and long distance run and walk. The athletes have been training in these sports since June and July to prepare themselves for this competition. 
Kenneth Beasom of West Middlesex and Mary Nigro of Sharon were partners and brought home gold medals in Division 1 of the bocce competition. Paul Paquet and Pauline Franklin, both of Sharon, were partners and also brought home gold in Division 2 of the bocce competition. 
Joseph Mesaros of Sharon brought home gold in the 5000m run and the 1500m run in Division A. Aaron Plummer of Sharon brought home a bronze in the 1500m run in Division B. Evan Ohlinger brought home gold in the 5000m run and the 1500m run in Division C and Garin Hernandez of Greenville brought home a gold in the 1500m walk. 
Next on the athletes’ agenda is a local competition to finish the bocce season and a long distance run/walk invitational scheduled with Lawrence County athletes. Athletes are also waiting to hear if they received an allocation to go to the state competition in November for the Fall Festival at Villanova University. 
Special Olympics Pennsylvania provides year-round training and competition in 21 Olympic-type sports to nearly 20,000 children and adults with intellectual disabilities or closely related developmental disabilities. For more information about how you can help “Reveal the Champion Inside” thousands of Special Olympics athletes, visit www.specialolympicspa.org .
